info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 12:07PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River.
Eel River at Bowling Green.
.Significant flooding is already occurring along the White River due to multiple rounds of heavy rainfall that brought around 5 to 9 inches to the area. Major flooding is expected from Spencer downstream on the White. The crest on the upper White should reach Anderson this afternoon, with much of the middle White cresting Monday and Petersburg and Hazleton not cresting until the end of the week.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...White River at Petersburg.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, A near record flood is in progress. Water level is at a height approached in June 2008 and exceeded in January 2005. Evacuations are necessary. River cabins are destroyed. Great damage occurs to rural county road system. SR 56 begins to flood in the Bowman area. Flooding may damage railroads. Flood waters overtop almost all levees in the Petersburg area.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Sunday /10:30 AM CDT Sunday/ the stage was 23.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EDT Sunday /10:30 AM CDT Sunday/ was 23.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.7 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 315 AM EDT /215 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
